text: Mice deficient for the <extra_id_0> 55 kd tumor necrosis factor receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are resistant to endotoxic shock , yet succumb to L . monocytogenes infection .

The multiple biological activities of tumor necrosis factor ( TNF ) are mediated by two distinct cell surface receptors of 55 kd ( <extra_id_0> TNFRp55 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and 75 kd ( <extra_id_0> TNFRp75 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .
Using gene targeting , we generated a <extra_id_0> TNFRp55 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient mouse strain .

Cells from <extra_id_0> TNFRp55 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mutant mice lack expression of <extra_id_0> TNFRp55 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> but display normal numbers of high affinity <extra_id_0> TNFRp75 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> molecules .
Thymocyte development and lymphocyte populations are unaltered , and clonal deletion of potentially self-reactive T cells is not impaired .
However , TNF signaling is largely abolished , as judged by the failure of TNF to induce NF-kappa B in T lymphocytes from <extra_id_0> TNFRp55 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient mice .

The loss of <extra_id_0> TNFRp55 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> function renders mice resistant to lethal dosages of either lipopolysaccharides or S . aureus <extra_id_0> enterotoxin B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
In contrast , <extra_id_0> TNFRp55 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient mice are severely impaired to clear L . monocytogenes and readily succumb to infection .
Thus , the <extra_id_0> 55 kd TNFR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays a decisive role in the host 's defense against microorganisms and their pathogenic factors .
